column1: "Certo! Il stress può influire sulla pressione sanguigna dei pazienti, aumentando la frequenza cardiaca e causando ipertensione. When the body is under stress, the sympathetic nervous system is activated, which releases hormones such as adrenaline and cortisol into the bloodstream. These hormones can cause blood vessels to constrict, leading to an increase in blood pressure. Prolonged or chronic stress can lead to long-term changes in the body that contribute to the development of hypertension. It's important for patients to manage their stress levels through relaxation techniques, such as deep breathing, meditation, or exercise, to help keep their blood pressure under control."
